data.name: How many elemental forms?
data.description: ## Introduction This kata is a *performance edition* of [Elemental Words](https://www.codewars.com/kata/56fa9cd6da8ca623f9001233). Each element in the [periodic table](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Periodic_table) has a symbol. We can form words concatenating symbols, for example `'C'` (carbon) + `'Ar'` (argon) -> `'car'`. In this (and in the original) kata, a sequence of symbol that can form a word is called an *elemental form* of that word. `'car'` hass only one elemental form, but in general, a word can have multiple elemental forms (e.g. `'flu'` -> `'F'`+`'Lu'`, `'Fl'`+`'U'`). There are also words without elemental forms (e.g. `'sea'`). ## Task Create a function that takes a word and return the number of *elemental forms* of the given word, i.e. the number of different sequences of symbols that can form the word (ignoring capitalization). Performances are important, the function should use an efficient O(n) algorithm. #### Input - **`word`** *[string]* - A non-empty string containing only ascii lowercase letters. Length: 1–15,030. #### Output - *[integer]* - Number of elemental forms of `word`. ## Examples ```python elemental_forms('bin') -> 3 # 'bin' has three elemental forms: # Bi + N (bismuth + nitrogen) # B + In (boron + indium) # B + I + N (boron + iodine + nitrogen) ``` ```python elemental_forms('sea') -> 0 # 'sea' isn't an elemental word # S is sulfur, but neither E nor Ea are chemical symbols # Se is selenium, but A is nothing ``` ```python elemental_forms('brass') -> 2 # 'brass' has two elemental forms: # Br + As + S # B + Ra + S + S a symbol can be used multiple times ``` ## Tests #### Correctness tests | | Number | Input length | Typical result | | --------------- | ------ | ------------- | -------------------- | | **Fixed tests** | 24 | `$1-222$` | `$0 - 7\cdot10^{9}$` | | **Tiny words** | 35 | `$2-20$` | `$0 - 26$` | | **Small words** | 40 | `$100-500$` | `$10^{6} - 10^{24}$` | #### Performance tests | | Number | Input length | Typical result | | ------------------- | ------ | ------------- | ------------------------- | | **Medium words** | 100 | ~ `$4\,000$` | `$10^{430} - 10^{450}$` | | **Large words** | 100 | ~ `$12\,000$` | `$10^{1110} - 10^{1140}$` | | **Huge evil words** | 100 | ~ `$15\,000$` | `$10^{2890} - 10^{2922}$` | Performance tests use long strings with a huge (sometimes insanely huge) number of elemental forms. Available time: **4.0 seconds**. *Reference solution time: 1.0–1.3 s*. ## Symbols This kata uses the symbols of all elements in the first 7 periods, from 1 (hydrogen) to 118 (oganesson). All symbols have length 1 or 2. There aren't temporary symbols (Uut, Uus, ...) or symbols of elements beyond 118. Here is the list of symbols (also available in `preloaded`): ```python ELEMENTS = [ 'H' , 'He', 'Li', 'Be', 'B' , 'C' , 'N' , 'O' , 'F' , 'Ne', 'Na', 'Mg', 'Al', 'Si', 'P' , 'S' , 'Cl', 'Ar', 'K' , 'Ca', 'Sc', 'Ti', 'V' , 'Cr', 'Mn', 'Fe', 'Co', 'Ni', 'Cu', 'Zn', 'Ga', 'Ge', 'As', 'Se', 'Br', 'Kr', 'Rb', 'Sr', 'Y' , 'Zr', 'Nb', 'Mo', 'Tc', 'Ru', 'Rh', 'Pd', 'Ag', 'Cd', 'In', 'Sn', 'Sb', 'Te', 'I' , 'Xe', 'Cs', 'Ba', 'La', 'Ce', 'Pr', 'Nd', 'Pm', 'Sm', 'Eu', 'Gd', 'Tb', 'Dy', 'Ho', 'Er', 'Tm', 'Yb', 'Lu', 'Hf', 'Ta', 'W' , 'Re', 'Os', 'Ir', 'Pt', 'Au', 'Hg', 'Tl', 'Pb', 'Bi', 'Po', 'At', 'Rn', 'Fr', 'Ra', 'Ac', 'Th', 'Pa', 'U' , 'Np', 'Pu', 'Am', 'Cm', 'Bk', 'Cf', 'Es', 'Fm', 'Md', 'No', 'Lr', 'Rf', 'Db', 'Sg', 'Bh', 'Hs', 'Mt', 'Ds', 'Rg', 'Cn', 'Nh', 'Fl', 'Mc', 'Lv', 'Ts', 'Og', ] ``` You can paste the list into your solution or use it to build some other data structure.
